Reviews.Title: “Location is a nice alternative to the International Drive and Disney hotels.”
Reviews.Author: gaken
Reviews.Content: As a number of other reviewers have mentioned, this Hampton Inn is really more oriented to business travelers than vacationers. When we arrived Sunday afternoon for our two night stay, it appeared the part of town it is in -- a business park area -- had "rolled up the sidewalks." However that was just fine for my wife and me; we have reached a point in our lives that we want to be away from the "excitement" when we turn in for the night while traveling. Even though a bit "removed from the action," it was not too difficult to get to our desired destination -- Seaworld -- by driving. However I did get turned around and was going the wrong way on International Drive before figuring it out. So it might help to have a map of the area or to turn on your GPS (I didn't becuase I thought I knew where I was going -- ha!) Speaking of GPS, we drove in on the FL turnpike, and the exit we were directed to take is a Sunpass prepaid only toll site (no cash accepted). Forturnately I saw this on the sign before getting off, and I just went on down the road a bit and was able to get turned around and, evenutally, to the hotel. This is certainly not the hotel's fault, but they might need to mention it in the driving directions on their website. This hotel definitely met Hampton's standards, and overall we were highly satisfied and would definitely stay here again when we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “We've Found A New Place To Stay In Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: sounddude
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed a room near the Orlando Convention Center for a couple of nights while we were to attend an Andrew Wommack conference at the Hilton. We had previously stayed at another hotel nearby but I was having trouble finding the listing for that property so with the help of The Negotiator, I started a new search. This Hampton Inn popped up for under $90 through one of Trip Advisor's partners so I reserved a room here as the ratings of this four year old property were 9+ out of 10. We checked in late and were quickly taken care of by the night manager herself and in no time, we had two hot cookies and were on our way to our room. I can't express enough how nice it is after a long day to find a spacious, super clean room waiting. If you've ever stayed in a Hampton, you know what the rooms are like: large and handsomely appointed. Again, this property is only 4 years old but a room can get wrecked in less time. Apparently, the management of this hotel takes constant steps to keep the place in top shape. The walls were unscathed, the beds were large queens, firm but not hard with pillow top mattresses, the cable television had lots of crystal clear channels to watch, WiFi was strong and fast. This room had a large mini-fridge that did not have a freezer section and also came with a microwave and coffee maker. The bathroom was spacious, looked brand new, comfortable and had a separate door from the rest of the room. Our room, 314, was directly backed by the elevators but we did not hear any noise at all from those units. Another nice touch was the ice maker and drink machine, which are normally next to the elevators, are actually in a closed room with a glass door. This prevents the sound of the coolers from disturbing the guests in the adjacent rooms as well as the sound of people filling their buckets with ice. We thought this was a real clever idea and kudos to Hampton Inns for coming up with this feature. The breakfast area is large with the typical annoying large screen TV at one end. These should never have the sound up as it causes all the patrons eating to speak loudly to be heard over the TV. We would suggest that management mute the sound and turn the closed captioning on. This would provide a more pleasant breakfast experience. The offering for breakfast at a Hampton is usually pretty good. Our first morning was great. Fresh fruit greets hungry travelers. The hot entrees were reconstituted scrambled eggs and sausage patties. The eggs were okay but the sausage was great. They also have the make-you-own Belgian waffles and cold cereal. Add to that all the normal bagels, muffins, apples (individually wrapped), etc., and you'll get plenty to fill you up. Also noted is that they had four different types of juice and three different types of coffee to drink. The second day the hot offerings were a cheese covered bagel and a cheese omelet. This was not the best idea as many people like myself do not or can not eat cheese so having the two hot foods both with cheese is not good planning. So I made myself a waffle. Where not terrible, it tasted like and had the consistency of pancake batter, which is much cheaper than good quality waffle mix so this could be improved but is a nit-pick. The second day fresh fruit offering was not as good as the first and we would recommend a greater variety in the mix. Still good but could be better. A nice feature of Hamptons is the free lunch bag they provide (until the daily supply runs out) at the front desk. These consist of various things like health bars, apples, bananas, a bottle of water, etc. A nice touch and we took ours to have for our break-time snack during the conference. The manager told us that this property was built as a business hotel as it's off the beaten path and right in the middle of a commercial complex, so it may be under the radar for many folks going to the theme parks or attending events at the Convention Center, which is only two miles away. We would highly recommend the Hampton Inn & Suites Orlando John Young Parkway for any travel to the Orlando area!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and large comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: buccij
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night before driving to Port Canaveral (about one hour drive) to embark on a cruise. I had called a few weeks before to ask about having packages sent to the hotel and the Front Desk Manager couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. We had a king suite with sofa bed which was ideal for our 7 year old. The room was very spacious and the bathroom quite large with whirlpool tub. Our room was quiet and the bed comfortable. We weren't in the hotel for long but found the staff very friendly and helpful. When I asked the hotel to send back one of my packages the front desk manager couldn't have been more accommodating, seemed like nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay a few days.”
Reviews.Author: Ltmiller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short visit to Orlando and could not have been more pleased. Hotel was clean, rooms spacious, and staff friendly. The breakfast was a great way to start our day. The price was a nice change in what we expected. Just a few miles from international drive through a lightly traveled business district, no heavy traffic. There are also several nice restaurants in a short drive. Easy place to stay and drive to theme parks, a lot less harried than staying on a theme park site. Accomidated my family well, I recommend this hotel for a short trip to the fun city of Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Latonia S
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night at this hotel, but my one night stay was good. Reasonably priced. Staff was courteous. Rooms were clean and up to date. Breakfast was good. Hotel wasn't extremely busy during my stay so the environment was quiet and clean. Location of hotel was perfect for me because I wasn't staying in Orlando for vacationing or to be near theme parks, but to visit a friend who lived off of John Young Pkwy. Hotel is near plenty of shopping areas and stores and not far from International Dr. There's road and land construction near hotel so it was a little dusty but that is out of the hotel owners control. I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: DelightsInTraveling
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent Hampton Inn. It looks very new and has been well kept up. We had a King Suite and it was spacious, clean, and very quiet. There is nothing near to this hotel in terms of restaurants or shopping, but that was fine with us as we didn't need any of those things. It's conveniently located about 15 minutes to the Orlando airport where we were going the next day (in our own car). Breakfast was the usual at Hamptons....very adequate. Cookies were good the night before, too! Extremely nice front desk staff -- both at check in, evening, and morning interactions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my Quick Stay”
Reviews.Author: GA_Lady_Traveler
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for one night on our way to Fort Lauderdale to catch a cruise ship. I had booked online through the Hampton Inn website and the only rooms available were those with 1 King bed. I went ahead and booked b/c the reviews for this hotel were very good and we needed to be in this area as it was located right off the turnpike. When I booked, I did specify I was a Hilton Honors member and wanted to request a two double bed room (they ask you if the room you wanted was available when booking, and if you answer no, then they ask your room preference). We arrived very early at this hotel (around 12:20pm) and were told the hotel was completely full, so they couldn't accommodate our request for two beds. They told us the room should be ready around 3pm (which is check-in time). We were directed to a mall area that had a lot of shopping and restaurants nearby. When we returned from lunch and shopping our room was indeed ready. They didn't say anything about the room itself, so I had just accepted that we were going to get the room we reserved. Imagine our surprise when it was indeed the two double beds! After about 45mins of being in the room, I received a call from the manager just to make sure the accommodations were okay (which they were). The beds were comfortable, the bathroom had been newly remodeled and it had all of the little toiletries one expects (shampoo, face soap, body soap, lotion). There was a refrigerator in the room with a small freezer so we were able to refreeze the cold packs we had in our portable lunch bag so our drinks could stay cool for the remainder of our road trip. While this hotel is in a business park (behind a business park actually), it is very quiet and seemed very safe. It's only a couple of turns/roads away from Orange Blossom (trail I believe it's called) and that is where the Florida Mall is (we didn't go in) and lots of chain type restaurants (Chili's, Red Lobster, etc.) and familiar shops. The hotel also had a pool and the breakfast the next day was decent (it's complimentary, so no complaints:-)) You could make your own Belgian waffle (the mix was pre-prepared; the iron beeped loudly when it was done. There was sausage and "eggs", bagels, pastries, juices and coffee (with flavored creamers). All in all, perfect for what we needed!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Quality, Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: littlejunk
Reviews.Content: We just wanted a base for a short trip to a few amusement parks. This Hampton Inn was well-rated on TripAdvisor and cheaper than the others in the area. While there was little within walking distance, there were stores a quick drive away, restaurants a little further and amusement parks within 10 minutes. The breakfasts were always hot, fresh and neat. The room was clean and quiet, in spite being next to the elevator. Would definitely recommend it for families and couples alike, a great location and good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura W
Reviews.Content: This is a very new Hampton Inn and Suites located in a business park therefore it is very quiet. The staff was very accommodating when we first arrived and provided us with directions to our event which was right down the road. The rooms were very clean as to be expected and as always, the breakfast was pretty good. There are no restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel - you will have to drive to any restaurants or shopping centers -but it was the closest shopping center was easy to get to. Overall, a pretty pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in an emtpy field”
Reviews.Author: WolfTravler
Reviews.Content: This is a good facility overall. The location is by itself near a buisness complex with no walking distance restaurants, or small stores. Now having said that, this is a great Hotel, great service and fantastic breakfast service, for Continental. Now Location for Orlando is Great. Halfway between Universal and the Magic Kingdom, and very close to Sea World. Nearby is the Florida Mall, approximately 3 mile drive. Closest Highway is FL-528 also called the Beachline.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rest for a couple of days.”
Reviews.Author: ILoveVacation4
Reviews.Content: This is a newer hotel and it is very nice. It is located in a much more quiet area than International Drive and still so close to all of the attractions (only 5-10 minutes). The rooms are very clean and the free breakfast is really good and plentiful. The only complaint is that the pool is not heated. Would stay again for a couple of nights, but never for a longer stay as there is not much to do at the hotel itself. It was very quiet and we were able to get some much needed rest after a 20 hour drive. Plus we loved the free cookies served each night!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Friendly w/a great price.......”
Reviews.Author: abcjjl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in one of their over-sized king studio suites. We usually stay at an area Orlando property before checking into our Disney Vacation Club timeshare stays, especially if our first night is on a weekend night. This hotel is very clean. It seems to be fairly new. I received a very friendly greeting at the front desk. A very good first impression and that makes a big difference. We went up the road to a 5 Guys for a quick dinner after arrival in the evening. The next morning we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast that made for an easy getaway to begin our first full day of our vacation.The trip to the front desk at Disney's Old Key West Resort was only about 10 minutes away to complete our early check-in process. We plan to stay here for our first night prior to starting our March '12 Spring Break trip to Universal. A great Hampton that should make the owners proud.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mikebaer
Reviews.Content: Great value. Friendly and efficient service. An excellent place for small business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Close to Florida Mall”
Reviews.Author: MrEdnWilbur
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when I had to go to Florida Mall for some serious shopping :) But there is another Hampton Inn much more closer to Florida Mall but I opted to stay on this property and was I glad that I did. Not only is this hotel cheaper but newer, quieter and had bigger suites! If you're looking to eat out, there is a mall across the street where you can go grab a bite at either Denny's, Amazonas Latin Grill, a Japanese or a Chinese restaurant. Another plus is the I-4 entrance ramp is only 3 to 4 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jenney b
Reviews.Content: We were supose to stay at the Quality Inn and Suites where we had a Resveration booked but that hotel was terrible so we searched the internet on our phones to see what was near by and found The Hampton Inn & Suites Orlando and had a Great Stay Beds vere very comfortable the staff was great and the breakfast was good We stayed Dec,26,2011 for 1 night Thank You Virginia

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel one night Jan. 3rd. Room and beds were clean and comfortable. Service was very good in my opinion. Jimmy behind the counter was very personable and helped me out with a couple of things without hesitation. Im a little concerned about what I paid after seeing other reviews.. I paid $99 for one night on a Tuesday for two people. I didnt have time to do the research and was glad to find a place to stay. All in all Im glad we landed at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the middle of nowhere!”
Reviews.Author: EyeCandy00
Reviews.Content: Be careful if you're driving because you can easily miss this great hotel! This hotel far exceeded our expectations. Imagine, $55 a night! we stayed 3 days here, and 3 days at Hampton Inn Coral Gales and it was $103 a night and not as nice! The hotel was very new and clean and spacious. It's just in the middle of nowhere! Literally! The sight outside is not very nice, construction going on everywhere ... and where doesn't have construction, has out of whack forestry. But that didn't bother us. It was very close to the malls and right across the street from a Walmart! The front staff was helpful and welcomed us with some Thanksgiving treats :) We only had a bad experience when leaving. We got the bill and saw they charged us for "long distance" calls. When we called the front desk to query and said we called only "407" LOCAL numbers (which are free), they said because I put a "1" in front of it, they consider it long distance so my billed showed over $44 in calls!! We were outraged and Maria at the front counter was adamant on the fact she could not help us, and could not fix anything until the manager comes back 3 days later! She could see the numbers that was dialed were local but said if we want we can "email a complaint". We couldn't believe it, she could see it was local, and she wouldn't pass on our message or offer to call an manager, but said we should "send an email"! She said it doesn't matter cuz "we've already been billed"..... So we definitely left on a bad note there. The manager however did call us 3 days later and left a voicemail advising all charges were removed and he apologized. But someone needs to do something about that! Apart from that, the room (416) was very spacious, clean and up to date, flat screens included! Make sure to go down to breakfast early as they start to clean up and remove stuff 10am sharp! Where as the Hampton Inn in Coral Gables were more accommodating especially to those who had families to allow them to eat and enjoy themselves without rushing! Overall, again i would recommend because for a 3 night stay - you can't beat $185 for a double queen room with micro and fridge and free breakfast! We'll definitely be staying here again .... just wont be using the phone! :)

Reviews.Title: “Business or pleasure this place is great”
Reviews.Author: Beni80
Reviews.Content: I had to come to Orlando a number of times on business. This place is the perfect place. It's located in the middle of everything, and yet it is safe and quiet. The continental breakfast was one of the best I ever had. If ever in town, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: newyoika
Reviews.Content: spotless, spacious, very friendly and helpful staff, lots of free parking, great (free) wifi. good rate even. would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place away from the busy-ness of International Drive”
Reviews.Author: sactokw
Reviews.Content: This is one of the newer Hampton in the area; it is quiet and located in more industrial park type area and away from the touristy International Drive. Yet it is close enough (<5 miles) from International Drive and Orange County Convention Center. Hotel is clean; desk clerks were nice; bed comfortable; cable TV (flat screen) with Showtime? (did not watch TV much); fairly large shower with Waterpik and good water pressure and lack of water temperature variations during showers; toilet with good flush; towels had good amount of fluff. Parking is free with lots of space; free wireless internet; standard breakfasts and snacks of usual Hamptons. Price of hotel is lower than other Hamptons due to location, but if you are looking for peace and quiet that is close enough to the hustle and bustle, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Goodguy7176
Reviews.Content: Newer hotel in the area - very quiet and worth it. Hamptons can be pricey but for three nights I was impressed. Easy access to lots of great restaurants and tourist attractions...I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable, quiet, clean and half the price of the convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandy P
Reviews.Content: If you're going to a convention at the JW Marriott down the rode, this is a great location. It's not on the back door of any of the entertainment or shopping scenes in Orlando, though they're certainly accessible, but that makes it a great choice for a business traveller who'd prefer to get some quiet and rest after a long day. Not the usual Orlando traffic either, so going the two miles back and forth to the convention took no more than 15 minutes and usually less. The staff were efficient, friendly and helpful, and all the usual amenities you expect at a Hampton were there. One reason I generally choose Hampton is the consistency and this one met that and did it a little better. I don't travel very frequently any more, so I don't know if this is now true in all Hampton's, but instead of a tub, there was a really nice roomy shower that was a big plus for me and made the bathroom seem much larger. The convention took care of most of the meals, so I didn't do much exploring there, but right across the main highway were every fast food place you might want in a hurry, plus a couple of moderate or budget choices. And it's not that far away from civilisation - other restaurants are near. A decent hot breakfast is served in the morning and a newspaper delivered under your door. All in all, a better choice than spending twice as much to stay at the convention hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in mouse town!”
Reviews.Author: bayougirl_11
Reviews.Content: Although my stay was only one night for a family wedding, it was a very impressive hotel stay. The room was very clean, the beds were very comfortable and even the temperature of the room was fantastic! The complimentary breakfast was great, even though we had it about 20 minutes before it ended. The batter for the belgium waffles had run out- and they made up a new batch for us quickly. Jimmy was very helpful, and even though I left my dress and jacket in the closet in our room, they are mailing it to me. I loved the location- not too far from downtown, yet no traffic or craziness to deal with. I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “One big mistake, avoid yourself the headache & don't be fooled by the great reviews”
Reviews.Author: JoePublic5461
Reviews.Content: I choose to stay at this hotel for two nights after reading the great reviews online. Do NOT be fooled by these. My stay was for two nights on September 24 and 25th 2011. The elevator was not working during my stay because the button was broken. To add insult to injury, I was given a room on the fourth floor. I had to walk up and down four flight of stairs to get to my room. Checking out was just as painful, as I had to make multiple trips using the stair to get all my stuff from the room to my car. The attendant behind the front desk barely gave me the time of day as she was too busy chatting on the phone. She was just downright nasty to me by her mannerisms and actions. The hotel itself is off the beaten path, the area is quiet and secluded with lots of construction going on at the adjacent lots. It also worried me that there were cops and police vehicles at this hotel every night and during the day. Why would they need cops? The cops made me worry that my vehicle would get broken into in the parking lot, or that this hotel was not on the up and up somehow. Maybe just a bad neighborhood, not sure. 100 percent guarantee or you money back is Hampton's slogan, that is all BS. Avoid this hotel at all cost, you will regret it. There are better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: WaltFlanigan
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for those who like to enjoy a good night's sleep after a day of shopping or theme parking...you wont have any trouble relaxing in the Hampton's beds. The staff were excellent...Jimmy was especially friendly and helped us get a driver (George from Morocco) to take us to Universal and he is also a whiz when it comes to making cookies! The breakfasts were plentiful and had a great selection for health conscious types as well as those who enjoy a stack of waffles or french toast sticks. Back to the location...you are a $20 cab fare away from Universal, or a 10 minute drive if you go yourself (look on a map, its not far from the park as well as the outlet malls and the Mall at Millenia). Been going to Orlando for weekend trips for the past six years and will be staying here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Edsr_10
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel from august 29 to 31,it was the best decision we made. The hotel was clean and the people there where very friendly and reliable,as soon as we check our self's in and went to our room they called us to ask if the room was up to our standards, when we need it anything we dint had to wait for long. I will definitely recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “So nice, so friendly, so helpful”
Reviews.Author: GoOnATrip_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently and had a wonderful experience. The staff was so nice and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The hotel was very clean and just what you would expect from a Hampton Inn. Loved it.....hope we can go back.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: shoppingaround
Reviews.Content: The employees were welcoming as we arrived. Check in was very easy and our room was very nice, clean, refrigerator, microwave and wonderful bed. The a/c worked so well and cooled us off after a trip to see the space shuttle go up for the last time. As we left at 2 am to see the shuttle breakfeast wasn't open yet so they gave us a bag to go with apple, muffin and water. Where else do you get that? On the mornings we were there the breakfeast was great. Hot waffles, fresh fruit, cereal, crossants, great coffee and juice. It was delicious and a welcome to fast food breakfeast. We would stay here again. All employees were welcoming and helpful and the area was right across the street from walmart and plenty of places to eat. Try this place great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Saved my trip!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmo978
Reviews.Content: After having an awful experience at a previously booked hotel, the evening receptionist, Suzanne found me a room within minutes and saved my mother's day weekend!!! Upon arrival she all but tucked us into a large comfortable bed and made sure that we were more than satisfied with everything!!! The pool was right outside my room, the fitness center was just what was needed and the staff helpful in every way! I would highly recommend this hotel and would 100% go back the next time I visit Orlando!!!

Reviews.Title: “Freezing pool, unreasonable and rude general manager.”
Reviews.Author: teachertim
Reviews.Content: Went on vacation, clean hotel but freezing pool - not suitable for swimming in half the year. Spoke to general manager about it - he did not like being challenged and became rude. We checked out and he refused to refund us two prepaid nights - even though we were dissatisfied and checking into another hilton (same group as Hampton) property! It is Hampton's policy to refund a whole stay if a guest is dissatisfied - this GM chose to ignore this, we only wanted a refund of two unused nights, not the whole 7 (which I feel under Hampton policy we were entitled to!). Front desk also could not open the safety deposit box - took them half an hour to get in. The GM knew we were having difficulty and did not come out of his office to help or apologise, even though it was next door to the safety deposit boxes. No wifi internet in rooms. had a problem conning to wired. Thin walls and lots of door banging - had disturbed sleep. Basically, clean hotel but let down by poor manager, unmotivated staff and a freezing, pool which is basically in the car park - don't believe the website pictures, pool is cold and unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: princessakikai
Reviews.Content: Me and the family stayed at this hotel and was surprised at how clean and nice it was. I love the design of the lobby and the rooms are spic and span. I would like to thank all of the staff for making our vacation in Orlando a wonderful experience. Special mention to the latina breakfast hostess who was extra nice and extra friendly with us. I would highly recommend this hotel and we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that makes you feel at home”
Reviews.Author: bridthetraveller
Reviews.Content: Great hotel only about a 10 minute drive from the airport. New and very clean. Was busy when we stayed last weekend. Staff are excellent Jessica who checked me in the night before remembered my name next morning now thats what I call Customer Service. Breakfast is nice good business centre and gym facilities. Avoid Dennys up the road food is bad. Would definately recommend this hotel, about a 10 minute drive to International Drive

Reviews.Title: “don't let your stuff visible for the housekeeper”
Reviews.Author: Alex0513
Reviews.Content: On July 4 and 5 i stay in that hotel with my family and who ever clean my room took my sunglases, an OAKLER -oil rig ( 150.00 ). I am a more than a 100 % sure that was there I talk with the manager and he don't do nothing, just said sorry Mr. Santiago. we are not responsable for items in the room. On the night of july four a try to talk with someone about it and no one in the reaciving just a laddy with a vacumm cleaner with her doughter in pijamas. I thing thats why is so cheap because they live with the customers stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up! The perfect place if you are not looking for a family-packed hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Michiel72
Reviews.Content: Originally we booked the Hampton Inn at South Kirkman Road, as it got great reviews on Tripadvisor. Don't have a clue how come... It was a nightmare. So we escaped to this Hampton. What a relieve!!! This is a very clean and mostly quiet hotel with spacious rooms. The hotel is very new and therefor you get what you expect at a Hampton. Cleanliness, rest and up to date rooms as well guest area. This hotel is mainly visited by business travelers; weekends usually families will stay there. It's not in the middle of the parks and a car will be necessary to travel around. For us that is a plus; we like a more quiet place instead of families taking over a place. Staff is very helpful and friendly. The general manager is very enthusiastic and eager to learn from guests experiences. Two thumbs up! Best Hampton Inn I have stayed in (and I have stayed in quite some..!). Close to Florida Mall and Mall at Millenia. Universal, Seaworld, Wet n Wild and Prime Outlet are close too. Disney and Premium Outlet are a bit further away. But still close enough (isn't everything closeby when you are in this part of Orlando??). Looking forward to my next visit. Can't be long...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not so great area to stay at...”
Reviews.Author: Theresa K
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a one night layover in Orlando. We are Hilton Honors members and that gives us better rates in the Hilton family of hotels. We arrived late in Orlando ( almost midnight) and were very hungry. We stopped at a nearby 7 Eleven and we were very scared, I must say. There was a group of youngsters drinking and smoking right outside ( which is a gas station!!! ) and they had a very unfriendly look on their faces. Bear in mind if you book this hotel that you will definitely need a car, there is nothing within walking distance, and this 7 Eleven, though quite a walk from the hotel, feels very unsafe. The hotel itself is very nice, the room is very spacious and has a microfridge and a coffee maker. They serve a very decent breakfast ( both hot and cold items) . As we arrived very late at night we requested a late check out and the front desk promptly granted our request at no extra charge. Parking is free but there is a huge sign stating hotel cannot be held responsible for personal items left inside the car. That sign added on to our feeling that the neighborhood wasn't a safe one. One good aspect though, is that all rooms are inside the building, and you need a key to acess the inside. Our room was very clean and we have no complaints at all. I'd say that, if Disneyworld is your destination and you plan to spend most of your time at Disney, this hotel is a long drive from their parks. It is closer to Universal and Sea World, but not really near. If distance and time are not an issue, and you won't be out later at night, I'd recommend this Hampton Inn. The hotel staff is really friendly, breakfast is a plus and the rooms are great!

Reviews.Title: “The best...”
Reviews.Author: kshaw86
Reviews.Content: Bed's and comforter's you will ever find anywhere, cheap with military discount and convienient for everyone...

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, ok for value, but suffers stinky smoky hallways with no air flow.”
Reviews.Author: tarepanda112
Reviews.Content: The lobby and pool areas are nice and well-maintained. Our room was clean, tidy, and comfortable, but the A/C was not that consistent and could be noisy. The hallway of our room was really stinky--smelled of smoke and there was no air flow. Our room was near elevator so there was lots of noise in the morning hours. There are probably equivalent places to stay for better value. Probably would stay here again but it would not be my first choice. Pros: free breakfast 6-10 AM and coffee and tea available 24/7 in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe and extremley comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: cheshirecat1007
Reviews.Content: When our trip to Florida was planned, we had made reservations at another hotel that was a nightmare. After spending 30 minutes in that hotel, we made reservations through Embassy Suites, explained our situation to the very nice reservation clerk who made our reservations with the Hamptom Inn. Hotel was easy to find, clean and a much needed relief. Being a single mom with a small child I felt very safe in this hotel especially when coming back at night after spending all day at the theme parks. The staff were so friendly, our room was always clean and the hot breakfast was great! Staying here contributed to our great vacation! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service, moderately priced”
Reviews.Author: Babear
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 1:30 AM. Night staff was very courteous, as was everyone we met, including the daytime reception staff and the woman maintaining the breakfast buffet. Included breakfast was an excellent deal with fresh fruit, do it yourself waffles, cereals, juice, coffee, toast/bagels/English muffins, and good (expensive) yogurt. Did not want to stay at cheap place because it's peak spring break, and didn't want to be up all night. Turned out to be an excellent choice. Just about 3 miles or 10 minutes from Universal, not far at all. Spacious, spotless room, the place appears to be brand new. If it's not, they do a heck of a job of keeping it up.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Hampton!!”
Reviews.Author: swcindye
Reviews.Content: I started staying at this Hampton Inn back in February 2008 and ever since then I call it my “home away from home” every time I travel to Orlando on business which is on average 2-3 weeks every month. For the past 5 years, I have traveled throughout the southeastern states and have stayed at a variety of Hampton Inns and this Orlando Hampton is by far the best one!! This Hampton is the best for a number of reasons. First is the cleanliness. Cleanliness is always the utmost priority for me (and I am very particular in this category!). During each and every stay at this Hampton property, I’ve found the rooms to be exceptionally clean and up to my very high standards. The housekeeping staff works extremely hard and does a super job of keeping the rooms and common areas of the hotel clean and fresh. Another reason why this Hampton property is the best is for the high-level of customer service the staff provides to their guests. Since I am in sales, I am cognizant to the quality of customer service that I receive. In my opinion, excellent customer service always starts at the top with the leader of an organization. They are the one who sets the tone and at this Hampton, it’s Jennifer Haskell, the general manager. She is an excellent GM and has assembled a fantastic group of people who are some of the most courteous, customer-centric and helpful people I’ve ever encountered! Jennifer and her team really understand how to give excellent customer service and excel in this category! Her team including Jennifer T., Temeka, Dimitrius, Joanna, Jhereka, Brittany and Jaymes are willing to do whatever it takes to make my stay comfortable and enjoyable. They are friendly and pleasant and welcome me back “home” with their smiling faces which is always greatly appreciated especially after a long day on the road. As others have mentioned, this Hampton is in a good location with numerous food and shopping options nearby and some within walking distance. The king suite rooms are spacious and equipped with a large flat screen TV, refrigerator and microwave. Also, this hotel is convenient to many Orlando attractions such as Disney, Sea World, Universal Studios, and the Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option-This is the new face of Hampton Inns”
Reviews.Author: Mesa-AZ
Reviews.Content: When you see brown, beige and yellow deco, know you are in a new place! We saw this treatment in the Keys and they are deco mavens there.... Spotless carpet, my first criteria was met handsomely. Marble and tile bath and our room had a walk in shower vs tub. I liked it. A wonderfully comfy bed. NO noise from hallway. The small frig was nice. This is in a quiet location and no food next door. However, get in the car, drive 3000 ft across J. Young Parkway to the strip mall with a plethora of choices. You need not go further. We recommend Amazonas Latin Grill to all. We don't normally talk about front desk help, but this group was refreshingly interested in their jobs. We would gladly stay here again. This place draws visitors from abroad, that speaks volumes.

Reviews.Title: “By far the nicest hotel my partner and I ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: cocolinu
Reviews.Content: Pros: room (king suite) very clean and very spacious with flat screen TV and a lot of channels( way more than what you'd usually get at a hotel); the hotel itself was clean; very nice front desk staff- they went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and happy, they were very helpful in helping us figure things out around the hotel (as in how to use the guest laundry facilities and such); housekeeping always prompt and always left the room spotless; the pool had a decent size; both the internet and the phone worked; breakfast was good; the hotel is located within a walking distance from a shopping plaza that also contains a few restaurants, but if you want a good, cheap meal, hop in the car and drive a bit, it's worth it (Cafe Tu Tu Tango is a very good option). We cannot say anything about the elevator or the upper floors, as our room was located on the main (lobby/entrance) level, it was however very quiet. What we found to be very well thought out and efficient was the fact that the sink was separate from the shower and the rest of the items you'd usually find in a traditional bathroom. Cons: -the pool, despite the fact that it was placed directly in sunlight, was quite cold and unheated; be aware that there is construction going on right across the street and it will get somewhat noisy in the pool area in the morning Neither pro nor con: -breakfast: consisted mostly of yogurt and milk; 3 types of muffins, 3 types of Danishes; biscuits; different types of juices, cereals, oatmeal (that came accompanied by hot water), fruits, and coffee (so there was quite a choice); however the hot item got to be quite repetitive (eggs prepared in different ways and ham) and decided to skip those in favor of the hot waffle and cinnamon sticks that were offered on 2 days

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Inn on our way back from Spring Training as we flew out of Orlando. The hotel is new and clean. It was not very busy so they upgraded us to a suite (which was an oversize King room with a sofa). The vanity is outside of the bathroom which was nice. The hotel is about 15 minutes from Disney World and about 10 minutes from the outlet mall. They had free internet service as well. We ate at a great restaurant , the Capital Grille, which was about 5 minutes ago. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: RedHeadGo
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn on Futures is a good choice if you need to stay closer to the South of Orlando. The hotel is a newer four story property that is located off John Young Parkway and very close to a lot of new dining/shopping. I got in late but I did see a Denny's Diner and a Walmart as well as a lot of smaller newer strip malls. Check-in/Lobby Check-in went smoothly and room requests were met. Staff was friendly and they were having a pizza reception when I arrived. I had just eaten dinner so I didn't eat any, but was a nice touch. Just wish they would have had some cookies (really what I was craving), you can't look gift food in the mouth :) The lobby was large and had a lot of tables and chairs. Room The room had two queen beds and was on the smaller side for a Hampton Inn. Maybe because I usually get a King Executive and this was just plain two doubles (all they had)? As you walked in there was a nice new closet with a icy glass type door with ample hangers, a very clean iron and ironing board. There was a larger than average mini-fridge and a microwave. The room had a desk and chair for business travelers with wired free high speed that worked perfectly. There was also another odd chair kind of tucked into the work station. The HVAC unit was thermostat, which I know sounds stupid, but I don't really like as I enjoy having a constant background noise (fan) when I'm sleeping. Temperature regulation was fine. The beds were extrememly comfortable, firm, just like I like them with both poly and feather pillows. The TV was a nice newer HD or Plasma with ample cable channels and closed caption. I did open the drawer on the nightstand and found a bag with empty candy wrappers. A little concerning, but that was really my only complaint. Room was very quiet, I didn't hear much noise from other rooms, a little noise above me, but nothing to complain about. The bathroom was very nice and had a large top on the vanity. They provide a decent size shampoo, conditioner and lotion. Water pressure was fine and shower was okay, however the bar stuck out a lot so watch your elbows! Other The hotel had a very small fitness center with two treadmills and an elliptical, however the machines, like everything else in the hotel was brand new and they had the TV option, so you just plug into the jack and can watch anything you want. Very nice. Business Center looked fine, had a printer as well. Water will cost you $2 in the machine, so you might want to bring your own, they also have a snack shop. Overall This new hotel is a great option if you are saying on the south end of town. I ended up here because all hotels near my office were booked. I probably won't stay again because it was a bit far out for me, but was a great stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn & Suites Orlando - John Young Pkwy / S Park
HotelInfo.Address: 7500 Futures Dr, Orlando, FL 32819
